item.title: Improved way of rendering TeX math in Hugo
item.description: Lincoln Atkinson wrote a post about TeX math typesetting in Hugo (archive) where he described a solution that could do TeX math typesetting with and without Javascript enabled. I have improved slightly upon his method, creating a simple Python script to download the equation images prior to publication and serving them from the local web server. Why? The primary reason was that I wanted a missing noscript equation to be an error at compile time instead of just a dead link.
